message: I have not started using it yet but I see many in the Django community singing their praises even though it is a Ruby based project. I also see that all buttons pressed, the Django non-rel web site uses Saas and Compass. Hopefully we can make this a good resource for getting going with the combo, and creating fluid adaptive designs.
At Djangocon eu there was a very goo presentation on the topic link here http://reinout.vanrees.org/weblog/2011/06/06/django-compass-less.html

I was a pythonista for several years. I don't know how the python community can *not* like sass. it's very pythonic in its style. Implementation language is irrelevant for many things. And why not learn a little ruby :) They are both great languages.
Here is an article from Eric Meyer on using Compass/Sass with Django http://compass-style.org/blog/2011/05/09/compass-django/
There's a python Scss implementation that compiles scss and compass: http://github.com/Kronuz/pyScss/
